subject: Massacre at Virginia Tech
body:
Tonight On CNN Email







April 18, 2007








 





7 p.m. ET


 

PRIME-TIME COVERAGE:  Massacre at Virginia Tech


CNN teams are live from Virginia Tech with the a look at the warning signs, the possible motive, and the gunman's checkered past.  Plus, hear from the last survivor to have seen the shooter alive! Our Primetime Special coverage begins tonight at  7 ET.




Related:• Cho's professor to classmates: Don't feel guilty• Police: Cho taken to mental health center in 2005• Source: Gunman angry at 'rich kids'• Victim grew up 2 minutes from Cho• Special Report







 
 





 




6:00 a.m. ET


 

American Morning


Our coverage of the Virginia Tech tragedy continues. Wake up with John Roberts & Kiran Chetry as new details continue to pour in.










 





6:00 p.m. ET


 

Lou Dobbs Tonight


With reports from around the world, Lou offers a unique look at the latest news.







7:00 p.m. ET


 

The Situation Room


Wolf Blitzer is LIVE from VA Tech with a look at missed warnings signs the shooter was dangerous.







8:00 p.m. ET


 

Paula Zahn NOW


Hear from the survivor who may have been the last to see the Virginia Tech shooter alive.  Paula Zahn is LIVE from the scene.







9:00 p.m. ET


 

Larry King Live


New disturbing details on the gunman in the Virginia Tech shooting from his roommate.  Plus, stories of horror and heroism with victims families and survivors.







10:00 p.m. ET


 

Anderson Cooper 360


Imaginary friends, stalking classmates, violent writings and more.  Why didn't anyone put all the warning signs together in time?  How did a mass murderer fly under the radar?  Anderson is LIVE from campus getting answers.
